Database module¶

class Database.Database(host, dbname, user, password, port, robotSerialNumber, serveurPort)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class managing the insertion of data in the postgresql database.

Inits Database with the host of the database, its name, the database-user name, its password and its port of connexion.

The roboSerialNumber is optionnal and serveurPort is the connection port of RTK server.

Create an instance of Server and APIWeather.

Parameters

  • host – Path of the database host

  • dbname – Name of the database

  • user – Name of the user used for the connection to database

  • password – Password of the database user

  • port – Connection port for the database

  • robotSerialNumber – optional, used for init the global variable of the robot serial number

  • serveurPort – Connection port of the server that send gps coordinates

Authors of this class : SOULLARD Thomas and TOURNEUR Hugo and CHENNUAUD Emmanuel and LAMBERT Vincent.

endSession()[source]¶

Complete information of a session with the end hour.

This method :

  • recover the end hour of a robot session,

  • format the hour,

  • put it in a POSTGRESQL request,

  • send it in the database.

insertResults(angle)[source]¶

Insert the results of an angle measure on the robot in the database with the actual weather.

This method :

  • recover and format the hour of measure,

  • recover the coordinates where the robot was,

  • call the APIWeather class to get the weather,

  • recover the angle measured,

  • send them in the Database with a POSTGRESQL request.

  • calculate the robot orientation vector and send it to database (qgis)

Parameters

angle – the angle measured by the angular captor

insertRobot(serialNumber)[source]¶

Insert a robot’s informations in the database.

This method :

  • obtain the serial number of the robot,

  • send it in the Database by a POSTGRESQL Request.

Parameters

serialNumber – the serial number of a robot.

startServer()[source]¶

This method start the server for reiceve the location.

startSession()[source]¶

Send to the database the start informations of the robot’s session.

This method :

  • format the start date, hour and coordinates,

  • put them in a POSTGRESQL request,

  • send them in the database.

stopServer()[source]¶

This method stop the server.
